title: Parsley and Egg Sauce
introduction: Parsley and Egg Sauce, also known as Salsa di Prezzemolo e Uova, is a traditional sauce from Trentinoâ€“Alto Adige. The richness of hard-cooked eggs blends perfectly with the fresh parsley, resulting in a creamy and flavorful condiment. This versatile sauce pairs wonderfully with poached chicken, salmon, and spring vegetables such as asparagus and green beans.
ingredients: 1 cup lightly packed fresh flat-leaf parsley
2 tablespoons capers, rinsed, drained, and chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Place the eggs in a small saucepan with cold water to cover. Bring the water to a simmer. Cook for 12 minutes. Let the eggs cool under cold running water. Drain and peel. Chop the eggs and place them in a bowl.
In a food processor or by hand, very finely chop together the parsley, capers, and garlic. Transfer them to the bowl with the eggs.
Stir in lemon zest. With a whisk, beat in the oil, lemon juice, and salt and pepper to taste. Scrape into a sauce boat. Cover and chill for 1 hour or overnight.
Remove the sauce from the refrigerator at least 1/2 hour before serving. Stir well and taste for seasoning.
variations: Stir in 1 tablespoon chopped fresh chives.
